===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|な}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=な}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> Possibly [[cognate]] with {{cog|ko|날||blade}}.

Obsolete in modern Japanese. Only found as an element in compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|な}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|な}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=な|obsolete}} a [[blade]], an [[edge]]
#* {{RQ:Man'yōshū|4|616}}
#*: {{lang|ja|劔大刀 '''名'''惜雲 吾者無 君尓不相而 年之経去礼者}}
#*:: {{ja-usex|剣太刀'''名'''の惜しけくも我れはなし君に逢はずて年の経ぬれば|つるぎたち '''な''' の をしけく も われ は なし きみ に あはずて とし の へぬれば|I do not even miss precious '''you''', given the years that have passed without meeting with you.}}
#*::: [Note: ''tsurugi tachi'' (“sword”) is a [[w:Makurakotoba|pillow word]] establishing a poetic association with the following ''na'', literally meaning {{m|en|blade}} or {{m|en|edge}} and alluding to sharpness and importance. This ''na'' could also elliptically mean {{m|en|name}} ({{ja-l|名}} ''na'') or even {{m|en|you}} ({{ja-l|汝}} ''na''), depending on context, based on the homophonic readings.]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|刀|かたな}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|は}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=は}}, cognate with {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha||tooth}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|は|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|は}}

# an [[edge]], a [[blade]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{lang|ja|刃}} (''yaiba''): a [[sword]], a [[blade]], particularly one that has been [[forged]]: see below

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|やいば}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=やいば|焼き|tr1=yaki|t1=burned, fired|刃|tr2=ha|t2=edge, blade}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=やいば|ha|ba}}

{{IPAchar|/jaki/}} + {{IPAchar|/ha/}} → {{IPAchar|/jakiba/}} → {{IPAchar|/jaiba/}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|やいば|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やいば}}

# a [[forged]] [[blade]], such as a [[sword]]
# the [[wavy]] pattern formed in the [[metal]] on the surface of a forged blade
# a [[sword]] or similar edged [[weapon]]
# something [[sharp]] like a [[sword]]
# someone or something [[powerful]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|刃は切れるが重宝|やいば は きれる が ちょうほう}}: “for a blade, cutting [sharpness] is precious” → the highest value of a tool is its ability to do what it is designed for
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じん}} {{m|zh|刃|tr=nyin<sup>H</sup>||edge of a blade}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|じん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じん}}

# a [[blade]], a [[sword]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|刃を迎えて解く|じん を むかえて とく}}: “to fall before the blade” → a metaphor for extreme strength or power
{{der-bottom}}
